meanings.sent1: She was tired of always being given the skivvy of cleaning the toilets.
meanings.sent2: In the household, washing dishes was considered a skivvy.
meanings.sent3: The skivvy of picking up everyone's trash seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent4: Taking out the garbage felt like the skivvy of all chores.
meanings.sent5: The skivvy of sweeping the floors made her appreciate the cleaner's hard work.

meanings.sent1: He wore a comfortable skivvy to the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The skivvy he had on was perfect for the warm weather.
meanings.sent3: His favorite skivvy had a small stain from lunch.
meanings.sent4: The skivvy she bought had a unique pattern on the sleeves.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric of the skivvy made it his go-to shirt.

meanings.definition: To work as a servant or laborer
meanings.sent1: She had to skivvy for the wealthy family to earn her keep.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, many people had to skivvy for their livelihood.
meanings.sent3: He decided to skivvy for a year to experience a different lifestyle.
meanings.sent4: Skivvying at the farm taught him the value of hard work.
meanings.sent5: Skivvying in the kitchen taught her new culinary skills.
